node.title: PragerU Presenter Karlyn Borysenko Says Jewish People Chose To Die In Holocaust
node.description: In a number of tweets, Borysenko also explained her spiritual beliefs mean that Adolf Hitler went to heaven because hell does not exist.

node.title: Justice Department sues Texas over redistricting, alleging discrimination
node.description: The suit alleges that Texas has "again diluted the voting strength of minority Texans."

node.title: "Reading Rainbow" to return after 15-year hiatus
node.description: "Reading Rainbow Live" will stick with the structure of the original version, but young viewers will be able to engage with the live show via the virtual platform.

node.title: U.S.-bound travelers scramble as new COVID test rules take effect
node.description: The new testing rules come as coronavirus cases rise ahead of the holidays. In the U.S., officials are reporting more than 100,000 new infections a day for the first time since early October.

node.title: What's behind the push for a fourth stimulus check
node.description: IRS has distributed almost 170 million payments. But hardship remains widespread as the Delta variant spreads.

node.title: What a former CDC director says about Omicron
node.description: Former acting CDC Director Dr. Richard Besser, pediatrician and president of the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation, weighs in on the latest COVID-19 variant.

node.title: Elizabeth Holmes returns to the stand on Tuesday.
node.description: Prosecutors have shown personal documents like text messages and notes that Ms. Holmes wrote and have emphasized that she was ultimately responsible for the problems at Theranos.

node.title: Unvaccinated Illinoisans Would Pay COVID Hospital Bills Under New Proposals
node.description: State Rep. Jonathan Carroll, who proposed the bill, said those who turn down the COVID vaccine should take responsibility for the potential consequences.

node.title: Americans Aren't Getting Enough Booster Shots, and It's Causing a Serious Problem
node.description: As COVID cases hit their highest level for two months, only a quarter of U.S. adults have had a booster shot.

node.title: Who Is Troy Billups? Outrage as Black Man Tackled by Minneapolis Officer in Viral Video
node.description: Activists are calling for Officer Christopher Lange to face disciplinary action after the incident inside an Aldi store in Minneapolis.

node.title: Teenager Catches Family Package Thief Using GPS Tracking Device
node.description: Justin Bankhead warned would-be thieves: "If you're going out there, you are going to get caught. People are smarting up."

node.title: Indonesia's president vows to rebuild after volcano eruption kills 34
node.description: Indonesian President Joko Widodo promises to bolster evacuation efforts and repair damaged homes after visiting the site of a volcanic eruption that killed at least 34 people.

node.title: 'There was no hoax': Empire actor rejects claims he planned attack on himself
node.description: Empire actor Jussie Smollett denies he staged a homophobic, racist attack on himself in 2019 in response to inaction by the show's producers over hate mail he received.

node.title: Emails reveal Pfizer was 'enthusiastic' to engage with Australia about COVID-19 vaccine
node.description: Documents obtained under freedom of information laws shed new light on Pfizer and the government's dealings at a critical time for negotiations last year.

node.title: Biden and Putin to speak amid tense military standoff in Ukraine
node.description: The video conference comes amid warnings from U.S. intelligence agencies that Russia may be planning to send troops into Ukraine as soon as January.

node.title: What are a coronavirus’s genes made of?
node.description: Here’s a viral genome question.

node.title: ​​How Long Will Jericho Continue Wrestling? He Let's Us Know
node.description: AEW superstar Chris Jericho has not only managed to physically perform at the highest levels for 31 years, he is still one of wrestling's biggest draws at the age of 51.

node.title: Joe Biden's Olympics Boycott Ties China in Knots
node.description: The Biden administration's decision to boycott Beijing 2022 has led to a mixed response from China, which appears to be caught between anger and indifference.

node.title: Montana seeks to end protections for some grizzlies, allow hunting
node.description: The request comes after bear populations have expanded, spurring grizzly attacks on livestock and periodic maulings of people.

node.title: Four Big Questions About Omicron
node.description: And experts’ answers.

node.title: Steve Bannon Wants Contempt Trial Delayed Until Just Before the Midterms
node.description: The DoJ believes it can wrap up proceedings against Bannon in a day in April, but the defense team argues more time is needed to prepare for the contempt case.

node.title: Atlas 5 rocket launches two Space Force satellites
node.description: Two NASA payloads hitched a ride to orbit in a $1.14 billion Space Force mission.

node.title: Why Would Russia Invade Ukraine? Vladimir Putin Fixated on Former Soviet Republic
node.description: Policy analysts and think tanks have said Moscow is intent on regaining imperial control of Kyiv.

node.title: Collapsed Miami Condo Units Are Still Listed For Sale
node.description: One man who lost family in the disaster told Newsweek the adverts "very painful and utterly disgusting."

node.title: The 10 top housing markets of 2022: Think Boise, not Big Apple
node.description: The hottest real-estate markets next year are likely to be smaller cities with greater affordability, Realtor.com says.

node.title: Novak Djokovic will play in the ATP Cup, organizers say, after weeks of uncertainty.
node.description: The announcement came after weeks of speculation about whether Djokovic would travel to Australia. It’s still uncertain if he’ll play in the Australian Open.

node.title: Military Ends Pearl Harbor Project to Identify the Dead
node.description: The remains of 355 sailors and Marines from the U.S.S. Oklahoma were identified using DNA and dental records, but 33 crew members could not be.

node.title: Photos: Death Toll Rises to 34 After Volcano Erupts in Indonesia
node.description: About 17 people were still missing as rescuers searched for survivors buried under volcanic ash.

node.title: How Many Countries Will Follow the U.S. Boycott of Beijing’s Olympics?
node.description: Several have signaled that they will find ways to protest China’s human rights abuses, whether they declare a diplomatic boycott or not.

node.title: State of emergency as storm hits Hawaii with flooding and high winds
node.description: Officials warned the dangerous conditions could persist through Wednesday, with power outages already reported across the state.
